metadata.title: CVE-2014-3570 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The BN_sqr implementation in OpenSSL before 0.9.8zd, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0p,and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1k does not properly calculate the square of a BIGNUMvalue, which might make it easier for remote attackers to defeatcryptographic protection mechanisms via unspecified vectors, related tocrypto/bn/asm/mips.pl, crypto/bn/asm/x86_64-gcc.c, and crypto/bn/bn_asm.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3570` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.8
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.8').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
